1. RSA signatures are multiplicative. That is, given S(m1) and S(m2), S(m1)*S(m2) will be a valid signature for S(m1*m2).
2. Use sieve of eratosthenes to generate a list of all primes up to 2000 (generating too many causes program to either slow or run out of emmory).
3. Grab RSA forgeries for every single prime.
4. Once the request is finished, factor the given challenge number.
5. Multiply the signatures of every prime factor together to get the forgery.
